ro.explanation: Clasa 'C' este o clasă abstractă deoarece conține funcții virtuale pure ('=0'). Nu pot fi instanțiate obiecte dintr-o clasă abstractă (declarațiile 2 și 4 sunt invalide), dar pot fi declarați pointeri către aceasta (declarațiile 1 și 3).

en.explanation: Class 'C' is an abstract class because it contains pure virtual functions ('=0'). Objects cannot be instantiated from an abstract class (declarations 2 and 4 are invalid), but pointers to it can be declared (declarations 1 and 3).

ro.explanation: Operatorul delete[] este utilizat pentru a elibera un tablou de obiecte și apelează destructorul pentru fiecare element al tabloului (în acest caz, de 3 ori).

en.explanation: The delete[] operator is used to free an array of objects and calls the destructor for each element of the array (in this case, 3 times).

ro.explanation: Metoda f() este virtuală, deci se folosește legarea dinamică (se apelează metoda din clasa obiectului indicat). Metoda g() nu este virtuală, deci se folosește legarea statică (se apelează metoda corespunzătoare tipului pointerului).

en.explanation: Method f() is virtual, so dynamic binding is used (the method from the actual object's class is called). Method g() is not virtual, so static binding is used (the method corresponding to the pointer's type is called).

ro.explanation: Expresia (++x)*(x--) se evaluează la 1*1=1, iar x este resetat la 0 după fiecare apel.

en.explanation: The expression (++x)*(x--) evaluates to 1*1=1, and x is reset to 0 after each call.

wrong_answers: se obține o eroare la compliare cauzată de faptul ca o metodă statică nu poate fi invocată folosind o referintă
se obține la executare excepția java.lang.NullPointerException
nu se poate apela o metoda membră statică pentru un obiect null
ro.explanation: Metodele statice sunt asociate clasei, deci pot fi invocate chiar și printr-o referință null.

wrong_answers: a compilation error occurs because a static method cannot be invoked using a reference
a static member method cannot be called for a null object
en.correct_answer: the program displays the message Static method
en.explanation: Static methods are associated with the class, so they can be invoked even through a null reference.

wrong_answers: Eroare la compilare: nu se poate aduna o valoare booleana cu un String;
Subprogramul se compilează şi la execuţie afisează :false 3 3 5 false 3 4 4
Subprogramul se compileaza şi la execuţie afisează false 3 3 5 false 3 5 6
ro.correct_answer: Subprogramul se compileaza şi la execuţie afisează:false 3 3 5 false 3 4 5
ro.explanation: Operatorul & pe biți evaluează mereu ambele părți, în timp ce && logic se scurtcircuitează.

wrong_answers: Compilation error: a boolean value cannot be added to a String;
The subprogram compiles and at execution displays :false 3 3 5 false 3 4 4
The subprogram compiles and at execution displays false 3 3 5 false 3 5 6
en.correct_answer: The subprogram compiles and at execution displays:false 3 3 5 false 3 4 5
en.explanation: Bitwise & always evaluates both sides, while logical && short-circuits if the first part is false.

ro.question: Având la dispoziție un număr nelimitat de monede cu valorile 7 RON, 6 RON, 3 RON și 2 RON, precizați numărul minim de monede cu care poate fi plătită suma de 19 RON:

en.explanation: The minimum number of coins to pay 19 RON with {7, 6, 3, 2} is 3 (e.g., 7+6+6).

ro.question: Indicaţi care dintre următorii algoritmi nu se bazează pe tehnica de programare Divide et Impera:
ro.explanation: Sortarea prin numărare este un algoritm de sortare prin necomparare și nu folosește strategia Divide et Impera.

en.question: Indicate which of the following algorithms is not based on the Divide et Impera programming technique:
en.explanation: Counting sort is a non-comparative sorting algorithm and does not use the Divide et Impera strategy.

ro.question: Considerăm un rucsac cu ajutorul căruia putem transporta 53 kg şi 7 obiecte având greutățile 10, 5, 18, 10, 8, 20 şi 40 kg, iar câştigurile obținute prin transportul integral al fiecărui obiect la destinație sunt 30, 40, 36, 10, 16, 10 şi 30 RON. Ştiind că din oricare obiect putem încărca şi numai o parte a sa, câştigul maxim pe care îl putem obține este:
ro.explanation: Aplicarea strategiei Greedy pentru rucsacul fracționar rezultă într-un câștig maxim de 133.5.

en.question: Consider a knapsack with which we can carry 53 kg and 7 objects having weights 10, 5, 18, 10, 8, 20 and 40 kg, and the gains obtained by full transport of each object to the destination are 30, 40, 36, 10, 16, 10 and 30 RON. Knowing that we can load only a part of any object, the maximum gain we can get is:
en.explanation: Applying the Greedy strategy for the fractional knapsack results in a maximum gain of 133.5.

ro.question: Care din următoarele afirmații sunt adevărate?
wrong_answers: La aplicarea algoritmului de sortare rapidă elementul din mijloc este mutat pe prima poziție.
La aplicarea algoritmului de sortare rapidă elementul de pe prima poziție este mutat pe poziția din mijloc.
La aplicarea algoritmului de sortare rapidă nu se alege niciun element pivot.
ro.correct_answer: La aplicarea algoritmului de sortare rapidă se alege un element din listă, numit pivot și se rearanjează lista, prin interschimbări, inclusiv prin mutarea pivotului pe o altă poziție, astfel încât toate elementele mai mici decât pivotul să fie poziționate inaintea lui, iar toate elementele mai mari să fie poziționate după acesta.
ro.explanation: Quicksort se bazează pe alegerea unui element pivot pentru a partiționa lista în două sub-liste bazate pe valoare.

en.question: Which of the following statements are true?
wrong_answers: When applying the quicksort algorithm, the middle element is moved to the first position.
When applying the quicksort algorithm, the element in the first position is moved to the middle position.
When applying the quicksort algorithm, no pivot element is chosen.
en.correct_answer: When applying the quicksort algorithm, an element from the list is chosen, called a pivot, and the list is rearranged, through swaps, including moving the pivot to another position, such that all elements smaller than the pivot are positioned before it, and all larger elements are positioned after it.
en.explanation: Quicksort relies on choosing a pivot element to partition the list into two sub-lists based on value.

ro.question: Care din următoarele afirmații sunt adevărate pentru Fig. 3?
wrong_answers: Arborele din figura Fig. 3 este vid.
Arborele din figura Fig. 3 nu este un arbore binar.
Arborele din figura Fig. 3 nu este un arbore binar de căutare.
ro.correct_answer: Arborele din figura Fig. 3 este un arbore binar de căutare.
ro.explanation: Un arbore binar de căutare (BST) este un arbore binar în care subarborele stâng al fiecărui nod conține doar noduri cu valori mai mici decât valoarea nodului, iar subarborele drept conține doar noduri cu valori mai mari.

en.question: Which of the following statements are true for Fig. 3?
wrong_answers: The tree in Fig. 3 is empty.
The tree in Fig. 3 is not a binary tree.
The tree in Fig. 3 is not a binary search tree.
en.correct_answer: The tree in Fig. 3 is a binary search tree.
en.explanation: A binary search tree (BST) is a binary tree where each node's left subtree contains only nodes with values less than the node's value and the right subtree contains only nodes with values greater than the node's value.

ro.question:
Se dau tabelele:
PERSONAL(Marca, Numepren, Compart, Datasv, Salorar, Salorarco, Compart)
PONTAJE(Marca, Data, Orelucrate, Oreco, Orenoapte, Oreabsnem)
Ce afişează următoarea interogare?
```sql
SELECT po1.Marca, pe1.Numepren, 
COUNT(DISTINCT po1.Data) AS Zile_Lucrate, COUNT(DISTINCT po2.Data) AS Zile_Lucrate_Comp
FROM (PONTAJE po1 INNER JOIN PERSONAL pe1 ON po1.Marca=pe1.Marca), 
(PONTAJE po2 INNER JOIN PERSONAL pe2 ON po2.Marca=pe2.Marca) WHERE po1.Orelucrate > 0 AND po2.Orelucrate > 0 AND pe2.Numepren='Ionescu' GROUP BY po1.Marca, pe1.Numepren, po2.Marca 
HAVING COUNT (DISTINCT po1.Data)> COUNT(DISTINCT po2.Data)
```
wrong_answers: Numărul de ore lucrate pentru toţi angajaţii, mai puţin pentru 'Ionescu'
Numărul angajaţilor care au aceleaşi zile lucrate cu 'Ionescu'
Angajaţii care lucrează în acelaşi timp cu 'Ionescu'
ro.correct_answer: Angajaţii cu un număr de zile lucrate mai mare decât ale lui 'Ionescu'
ro.explanation: The query compares the count of distinct working days for each employee (`po1`) with the count of distinct working days for 'Ionescu' (`po2`) and filters for those with a higher count.

en.question:
Given the tables:
PERSONAL(Marca, Numepren, Compart, Datasv, Salorar, Salorarco, Compart)
PONTAJE(Marca, Data, Orelucrate, Oreco, Orenoapte, Oreabsnem)
What does the following query display?
```sql
SELECT po1.Marca, pe1.Numepren, 
COUNT(DISTINCT po1.Data) AS Zile_Lucrate, COUNT(DISTINCT po2.Data) AS Zile_Lucrate_Comp
FROM (PONTAJE po1 INNER JOIN PERSONAL pe1 ON po1.Marca=pe1.Marca), 
(PONTAJE po2 INNER JOIN PERSONAL pe2 ON po2.Marca=pe2.Marca) WHERE po1.Orelucrate > 0 AND po2.Orelucrate > 0 AND pe2.Numepren='Ionescu' GROUP BY po1.Marca, pe1.Numepren, po2.Marca 
HAVING COUNT (DISTINCT po1.Data)> COUNT(DISTINCT po2.Data)
```
wrong_answers: Number of hours worked for all employees, except for 'Ionescu'
Number of employees who have the same working days as 'Ionescu'
Employees working at the same time as 'Ionescu'
en.correct_answer: Employees with a number of days worked greater than that of 'Ionescu'
en.explanation: The query compares the count of distinct working days for each employee (`po1`) with the count of distinct working days for 'Ionescu' (`po2`) and filters for those with a higher count.

ro.question: Folosind relaţia cadru_did(cod, nume, graddid, data_ang, sal_neg, sal_merit), să se specifice care dintre următoarele exemple este corectă:
wrong_answers: SELECT graddid, sum(sal_neg), count(cod) FROM cadru_did GROUP BY data_ang
SELECT graddid, avg(sal_neg) FROM cadru_did WHERE avg(sal_neg) > 1800
ro.explanation: `SELECT avg(sal_neg) FROM cadru_did` is a valid aggregate query. The other options are incorrect because they either mix non-aggregated columns with aggregates without a `GROUP BY` or use an aggregate in a `WHERE` clause.

en.question: Using the relation cadru_did(cod, nume, graddid, data_ang, sal_neg, sal_merit), specify which of the following examples is correct:
wrong_answers: SELECT graddid, sum(sal_neg), count(cod) FROM cadru_did GROUP BY data_ang
SELECT graddid, avg(sal_neg) FROM cadru_did WHERE avg(sal_neg) > 1800
en.explanation: `SELECT avg(sal_neg) FROM cadru_did` is a valid aggregate query. The other options are incorrect because they either mix non-aggregated columns with aggregates without a `GROUP BY` or use an aggregate in a `WHERE` clause.

ro.question: Ce caracteristică este utilizată pentru a preveni conflictele de actualizare, astfel incât utilizatorii să nu poată citi sau modifica datele când alţi utilizatori le modifică?
ro.explanation: Locks are mechanisms used by the DBMS to manage concurrent access, preventing multiple users from modifying the same data simultaneously.

en.question: What feature is used to prevent update conflicts so that users cannot read or modify data when other users are modifying it?
en.explanation: Locks are mechanisms used by the DBMS to manage concurrent access, preventing multiple users from modifying the same data simultaneously.

ro.question: Când ştergeţi un tabel, ce obiecte din baza de date se şterg de asemenea?
wrong_answers: Vederile care-l au ca tabel de bază
ro.explanation: Triggers are specifically attached to a table and are automatically removed when the table is dropped. Views and stored procedures remain but will fail when executed.

wrong_answers: Views that have it as a base table
en.explanation: Triggers are specifically attached to a table and are automatically removed when the table is dropped. Views and stored procedures remain but will fail when executed.

ro.question: Baza de date folosită de dumneavoastră conține o tabelă numită Employees, care are o coloană de tip nvarchar(MAX) numită lastName.Aveți deja un index clustered numit id_index pe coloana id a tabelei. Unul dintre utilizatorii dumneavoastră reclamă timpii de interogare lungi obținuți când folosește coloana lastName în clauza WHERE a instrucțiunii SELECT. Ce instrucțiune ar trebui să folosiți?
wrong_answers: ALTER INDEX id_index ON Employees (id, lastName);

CREATE INDEX id_name_index ON Employees (id)
INCLUDE (lastName);
CREATE CLUSTERED INDEX name_index ON Employees (lastName);
ro.explanation: Creating a non-clustered index on the `lastName` column will significantly speed up queries that filter by that column.

en.question: The database you use contains a table named Employees, which has an nvarchar(MAX) column named lastName. You already have a clustered index named id_index on the id column of the table. One of your users complains about the long query times obtained when using the lastName column in the WHERE clause of the SELECT statement. What statement should you use?
wrong_answers: ALTER INDEX id_index ON Employees (id, lastName);

CREATE INDEX id_name_index ON Employees (id)
INCLUDE (lastName);
CREATE CLUSTERED INDEX name_index ON Employees (lastName);
en.explanation: Creating a non-clustered index on the `lastName` column will significantly speed up queries that filter by that column.

ro.question: Ce fișier conține informații despre parolele utilizatorilor?
ro.explanation: While `/etc/passwd` contains user account information, the actual encrypted passwords (or hashes) are stored in the restricted `/etc/shadow` file for security.

en.explanation: While `/etc/passwd` contains user account information, the actual encrypted passwords (or hashes) are stored in the restricted `/etc/shadow` file for security.

ro.question: Cum verifici dacă un fișier există într-un script Bash?
ro.explanation: The `[` (test) command uses `-e` to check if a name exists (file or directory) and `-f` to check specifically if it is a regular file.

en.question: How do you check if a file exists in a Bash script?
en.explanation: The `[` (test) command uses `-e` to check if a name exists (file or directory) and `-f` to check specifically if it is a regular file.

ro.question: Ce face comanda grep -rl "text" /var/log?
wrong_answers: Afișează liniile care conțin "text" din fișierele din /var/log.
Caută recursiv "text" în directorul /var/log și afișează conținutul.
ro.correct_answer: Caută și afișează doar numele fișierelor care conțin "text".
ro.explanation: The `-r` (recursive) flag searches through subdirectories, and `-l` (files-with-matches) tells `grep` to only print the names of files that contain the pattern.

en.question: What does the command grep -rl "text" /var/log do?
wrong_answers: Displays the lines containing "text" from files in /var/log.
Recursively searches for "text" in the /var/log directory and displays the content.
en.correct_answer: Searches and displays only the names of files that contain "text".
en.explanation: The `-r` (recursive) flag searches through subdirectories, and `-l` (files-with-matches) tells `grep` to only print the names of files that contain the pattern.

ro.question: Care este rolul unei adrese de broadcast?
wrong_answers: de a transmite un pachet către o singură rețea destinație
de a trimite un pachet către o listă de destinație
de a trimite un mesaj către toate ruterele dintr o rețea

to send a packet to a destination list
to send a message to all routers in a network
en.correct_answer: to send a message to all hosts in a network/subnet
en.explanation: A broadcast address is used to send a single packet to all devices within a specific network or subnet simultaneously.

ro.question: Adresele IPv6 unicast agregabile globale:
ro.explanation: Global unicast addresses are the equivalent of public IPv4 addresses. They are globally unique and routable on the internet, typically starting with the prefix `2000::/3` (binary `001`).

wrong_answers: Have a total length of 64 bits

ro.question: Un sistem criptografic pentru transmiterea/recepția informației se compune din:
wrong_answers: Bloc de criptare si bloc de decriptare fără chei criptografice;
Bloc de criptare cu două chei criptografice identice;
Bloc de criptare cu doua chei criptografice diferite.
ro.correct_answer: Bloc de criptare si bloc de decriptare cu chei criptografice diferite;
ro.explanation: A complete system includes both the encryption process at the source and the decryption process at the destination, often using different keys (asymmetric) or the same key (symmetric).

en.question: A cryptographic system for transmitting/receiving information consists of:
wrong_answers: Encryption block and decryption block without cryptographic keys;
Encryption block with two identical cryptographic keys;
Encryption block with two different cryptographic keys.
en.correct_answer: Encryption block and decryption block with different cryptographic keys;

ro.question: Un sistem secret cu acoperire unică (cifru cu cheie unică sau cifru Vernam) se bazează:
ro.explanation: The One-Time Pad achieves perfect secrecy solely through 'confusion', as there is no pattern or structure to diffuse.

en.question: A one time secret system (one time pad or Vernam cipher) is based on:
en.explanation: The One-Time Pad achieves perfect secrecy solely through 'confusion', as there is no pattern or structure to diffuse.

ro.question: Presupunem că Alice dorește să transmită lui Bob mesajul “TRIMIT AJUTOR”, folosind un canal de comunicație nesigur. Atât ea cât și Bob au obținut printr o metodă necunoscută o cheie de cifrare generată în mod aleator și anume: “AFVKGHOPERTS”. Pentru a cifra mesajul Alice va utiliza cifrul VERNAM cu operații modulo 26. În urma operației de cifrare mesajul primit de Bob va fi:
ro.explanation: Using the VERNAM cipher (A=0, B=1...): T(19)+A(0)=T(19), R(17)+F(5)=W(22), I(8)+V(21)=D(29 mod 26 = 3), etc. The result is 'TWDWOAOYOKHJ'.

en.question: Assume Alice wants to transmit the message “TRIMIT AJUTOR” to Bob using an insecure communication channel. Both she and Bob obtained through an unknown method a randomly generated encryption key: “AFVKGHOPERTS”. To encrypt the message Alice will use the VERNAM cipher with modulo 26 operations. Following the encryption operation the message received by Bob will be:
en.explanation: Using the VERNAM cipher (A=0, B=1...): T(19)+A(0)=T(19), R(17)+F(5)=W(22), I(8)+V(21)=D(29 mod 26 = 3), etc. The result is 'TWDWOAOYOKHJ'.

ro.question: Sistemul electronic de transfer de fonduri (EFT-Electronic Found Transfer) reprezinta:
wrong_answers: un protocol de comunicatie intre POS (Point Of Sales) si ATM (Automatic Teller Machine)
o instructiune comuna la nivel mondial pentru sistemele bancare
ro.correct_answer: ansamblul dispozitivelor si procedeelor speciale care asigura deplasarea fluxurilor monetare de la platitor la beneficiar intr-un mediu exclusiv electronic

en.question: The electronic funds transfer system (EFT) represents:
wrong_answers: a communication protocol between POS (Point Of Sales) and ATM (Automatic Teller Machine)
a common instruction worldwide for banking systems
en.correct_answer: the set of special devices and procedures that ensure the movement of monetary flows from the payer to the beneficiary in an exclusively electronic environment
en.explanation: EFT (Electronic Fund Transfer) is defined as the set of special devices and procedures that ensure the movement of monetary flows from payer to beneficiary in an exclusively electronic environment, not a simple protocol or banking instruction.

ro.explanation: AWS SNS (Simple Notification Service) permite setarea, operarea și transmiterea notificărilor către diverse servicii din aplicații diferite. Celelalte opțiuni descriu funcționalități ale altor servicii AWS.

wrong_answers: Provide subscriptions such as: email, HTTP/HTTPS, SMS text, SQS Queries, Lambda functions
Monitor and command an EC2 instance

ro.question:
Considerăm următoarea secvență de instrucțiuni Python:
```python
s = input()
t = ""
for x in range(ord("a"), ord("z")+1):
t += chr(x) * s.count(chr(x))
print(t)
```
Pentru orice șir format doar din litere mici ale alfabetului englez introdus de la tastatură secvența dată este echivalentă cu:
wrong_answers:
```python
s = input()
t = sum([x*s.count(chr(x)) for x in range(ord("a"), ord("z")+1)])
print(t)
```

```python
s = input()
t = ""
for x in set(sorted(set(s))):
t += x * s.count(x)
print(t)
```
ro.explanation: Ambele abordări rezultă într-un șir format din caractere sortate.

en.question:
Consider the following sequence of Python instructions:
```python
s = input()
t = ""
for x in range(ord("a"), ord("z")+1):
t += chr(x) * s.count(chr(x))
print(t)
```
For any string consisting only of lowercase English alphabet letters entered from the keyboard, the given sequence is equivalent to:
wrong_answers:
```python
s = input()
t = sum([x*s.count(chr(x)) for x in range(ord("a"), ord("z")+1)])
print(t)
```

```python
s = input()
t = ""
for x in set(sorted(set(s))):
t += x * s.count(x)
print(t)
```
en.explanation: Both approaches result in a string of sorted characters.

ro.question:
Se consideră un triunghi de numere întregi format din n linii, astfel: prima linie conține un număr, a doua linie conține două numere,. . ., ultima linie conține n numere. În acest triunghi se pot forma sume de numere întregi în felul următor:

en.question:
Consider a triangle of integers consisting of n rows: the first row contains one number, the second two numbers, ..., the last row n numbers. In this triangle, sums of integers can be formed as follows:
- the number on the first row is selected;
- at each step, either the number on the next row below the last selected number or the number on the next row and one column to the right of the last selected number is selected, until the last row of the triangle is reached.
A minimum complexity algorithm that determines the largest sum that can be obtained following the rules above uses the method:
en.explanation: Finding the maximum path sum in a triangle is a classic problem solved efficiently using dynamic programming.

ro.question: Trebuie să creați o constrângere care să vă asigure că toate valorile atribuite coloanei car_id din tabela CarAssignments corespund unei valori a coloanei id din tabela Cars. De asemenea, trebuie să vă asigurați că, dacă se șterge o linie din tabela Cars, se vor șterge și liniile din tabela CarAssignments care o referențiază. Ce instrucțiune ar trebui folosită?
wrong_answers: ALTER TABLE CarAssignments ADD CONSTRAINT FK_car_id FOREIGN KEY (car_id) REFERENCES Cars (id) ON DELETE SET NULL;
ALTER TABLE CarAssignments ADD CONSTRAINT FK_car_id FOREIGN KEY (car_id) REFERENCES Cars (id);
ALTER TABLE CarAssignments ADD CONSTRAINT FK_car_id FOREIGN KEY (car_id) REFERENCES Cars (id) ON DELETE NO ACTION;
ro.correct_answer: ALTER TABLE CarAssignments ADD CONSTRAINT FK_car_id FOREIGN KEY (car_id) REFERENCES Cars (id) ON DELETE CASCADE;
ro.explanation: The `ON DELETE CASCADE` option in a foreign key constraint ensures that when a parent row is deleted, all its child rows are automatically deleted as well.

en.question: You need to create a constraint that ensures all values assigned to the car_id column in the CarAssignments table correspond to a value in the id column of the Cars table. You also need to ensure that if a row is deleted from the Cars table, rows in the CarAssignments table referencing it are also deleted. Which statement should be used?
wrong_answers: ALTER TABLE CarAssignments ADD CONSTRAINT FK_car_id FOREIGN KEY (car_id) REFERENCES Cars (id) ON DELETE SET NULL;
ALTER TABLE CarAssignments ADD CONSTRAINT FK_car_id FOREIGN KEY (car_id) REFERENCES Cars (id);
ALTER TABLE CarAssignments ADD CONSTRAINT FK_car_id FOREIGN KEY (car_id) REFERENCES Cars (id) ON DELETE NO ACTION;
en.correct_answer: ALTER TABLE CarAssignments ADD CONSTRAINT FK_car_id FOREIGN KEY (car_id) REFERENCES Cars (id) ON DELETE CASCADE;
en.explanation: The `ON DELETE CASCADE` option in a foreign key constraint ensures that when a parent row is deleted, all its child rows are automatically deleted as well.

ro.question: Un exemplu de indicator de inovare la nivel de sistem de cercetare-dezvoltare-inovare (sistemul național) este următorul:
wrong_answers: Influențele externe asupra inovării (inclusiv politicile publice) și condițiile cadru pentru inovare (inclusiv infrastructura de cunoaștere).
Un model de proces de inovare, care presupune că inovațiile sunt generate de organizație și împinse către piață, fără a se ține cont de nevoile pieței.
Un model de proces de inovare care ține cont de nevoile pieței, respectiv care presupune orientarea activităților de cercetare-dezvoltare în funcție de cerințele pieței.
ro.correct_answer: Firme care utilizează tehnologii avansate, tehnologii generice esențiale (Key Enabling Technologies) sau tehnologii emergente (% din total firme).
ro.explanation: Procentajul firmelor care utilizează tehnologii avansate sau emergente este un indicator de inovare la nivel de sistem național, reflectând adoptarea tehnologică în economie, nu un model de proces sau o influență externă.

en.question: An example of an innovation indicator at the level of the research-development-innovation system (national system) is the following:
wrong_answers: External influences on innovation (including public policies) and framework conditions for innovation (including knowledge infrastructure).
An innovation process model, which assumes that innovations are generated by the organization and pushed towards the market, without taking into account market needs.
An innovation process model that takes into account market needs, respectively which assumes the orientation of research-development activities according to market requirements.
en.correct_answer: Firms using advanced technologies, Key Enabling Technologies or emerging technologies (% of total firms).
en.explanation: The percentage of firms using advanced or emerging technologies is an innovation indicator at the national system level, reflecting technological adoption in the economy, not a process model or external influence.

ro.question:
Considerăm următoarea secvență de instrucțiuni Python:
```python
s = 0
while n > 0:
if n % 10 > s: s = n % 10
else:
break
n = n // 10
else:
s = 10
print(s)
```
Ce valoare se va afișa după executarea secvenței de mai sus pentru n = 75321?
ro.explanation: Blocul 'else' se execută dacă bucla se termină fără a fi întreruptă de 'break'.

en.question:
Consider the following sequence of Python instructions:
```python
s = 0
while n > 0:
if n % 10 > s: s = n % 10
else:
break
n = n // 10
else:
s = 10
print(s)
```
What value will be displayed after executing the sequence above for n = 75321?
en.explanation: The 'else' block executes if the loop completes without being interrupted by 'break'.

ro.question:
Considerăm următoarea secvență de instrucțiuni Python:
```python
x, y, t = 0, 1, 10
while t > 0:
x, y, t = y, x+y, t-1
print(x, y)
```
Ce valori se vor afișa după executarea secvenței de mai sus?
ro.explanation: Acest cod implementează secvența Fibonacci, rezultatul fiind termenii 10 și 11.

en.question:
Consider the following sequence of Python instructions:
```python
x, y, t = 0, 1, 10
while t > 0:
x, y, t = y, x+y, t-1
print(x, y)
```
What values will be displayed after executing the sequence above?
en.explanation: This code implements the Fibonacci sequence, result is the 10th and 11th terms.

ro.question:
Considerăm următoarea secvență de instrucțiuni Python:
```python
t = set([x for x in range(0, 21, 2)] * 2)
u = [x for x in range(0, 31, 3)] * 3
t = t.intersection(u)
t.update(tuple(u))
print(len(t))
```
Ce se va afișa pe ecran după executarea secvenței date?
ro.explanation: Operațiile cu mulțimi reduc colecțiile la 11 elemente unice.

en.question:
Consider the following sequence of Python instructions:
```python
t = set([x for x in range(0, 21, 2)] * 2)
u = [x for x in range(0, 31, 3)] * 3
t = t.intersection(u)
t.update(tuple(u))
print(len(t))
```
What will be displayed on the screen after executing the given sequence?
en.explanation: Set operations reduce the collections to 11 unique elements.

ro.question:
Se consideră următorul triunghi de numere întregi format din n = 4 linii:
10
12 -20
30 50 180
21 14 20 16
În acest triunghi se pot forma sume de numere întregi în felul următor:
- se selectează numărul aflat pe prima linie;
- la fiecare pas se selectează fie numărul aflat pe următoarea linie sub ultimul număr selectat, fie numărul aflat pe următoarea linie și o coloană la dreapta față de ultimul număr selectat, până când se ajunge pe ultima linie a triunghiului de numere.
Care este suma maximă ce poate fi obținută în triunghiul dat, respectând condițiile precizate mai sus?
ro.explanation: Calculând sumele maxime de jos în sus, suma maximă pe o cale pentru acest triunghi este 190.

en.explanation: By calculating the maximum sums from the bottom up, the maximum path sum for this triangle is 190.

ro.question: Operatorul NOT nu se poate folosi cu:
ro.explanation: In standard SQL, `NOT` is used with boolean expressions or operators like `LIKE`, `IN`, `BETWEEN`, `EXISTS`, and `IS NULL`. While you can say `NOT (x > y)`, the operator itself is usually `!=` or `<>` for 'not greater than' (which is `<=`).

ro.explanation: Principalele amenințări asupra tranzacțiilor e-commerce includ toate cele menționate: interceptarea informațiilor de plată, interceptarea parolelor/PIN-urilor și modificarea datelor tranzacțiilor.

ro.question: Care din urmatoarele enunturi referitoare la comertul electronic este fals:
wrong_answers: eBay.com este cel mai mare magazin de comert electronic la nivel mondial
Skimming-ul si phishing-ul utilizate in fraude cu carduri bancare si furt de identitate reprezinta infractiuni criminale informatice

Protocolul SET (Secure Electronic Transaction) reprezinta un pachet de specificatii de securitate si de formate, dezvoltat de Visa si MasterCard, care permit utilizatorilor sa efectueze plati electronice cu cardurile bancare in Internet
ro.correct_answer: E-commerce (comertul electronic) reprezinta o strategie moderna in ceea ce priveste modul de a face afaceri, cea mai importanta componenta a sa fiind E-business (alaceri electronice)
ro.explanation: Afirmația este falsă deoarece inversează relația: E-business este conceptul mai larg care include E-commerce ca componentă, nu invers. E-commerce (comerțul electronic) este o parte componentă a E-business (afaceri electronice).

en.question: Which of the following statements regarding e-commerce is false:
wrong_answers: eBay.com is the world's largest e-commerce store
Skimming and phishing used in bank card fraud and identity theft represent computer criminal offenses

The SET (Secure Electronic Transaction) protocol represents a package of security specifications and formats, developed by Visa and MasterCard, which allow users to make electronic payments with bank cards on the Internet
en.correct_answer: E-commerce (electronic commerce) represents a modern strategy regarding the way of doing business, its most important component being E-business (electronic business)
en.explanation: The statement is false because it reverses the relationship: E-business is the broader concept that includes E-commerce as a component, not the other way around. E-commerce is a component part of E-business (electronic business).

ro.question: Stabiliți care dintre următoarele propoziții referitoare la tehnica de programare Greedy sunt adevărate:

ro.explanation: Algoritmii Greedy garantează o soluție optimă doar dacă criteriul de selecție este demonstrat matematic.

en.question: Determine which of the following sentences referring to the Greedy programming technique are true:
wrong_answers: it always leads to an optimal solution;
it builds a solution element by element and if the value of the current element does not verify certain conditions it is given up and it returns to the previous element;
it finds all solutions of a problem;
en.correct_answer: it leads to an optimal solution only if the correctness of the selection criterion based on which an element from the initial set is added to the problem solution has been mathematically proven.
en.explanation: Greedy algorithms only guarantee an optimal solution if the selection criterion is mathematically proven.

ro.question: Pentru a afişa numele angajaţilor care au un salariu mai mare decât al cel puţin unui manager existent, ar trebui să folosiţi instrucţiunea: `SELECT name FROM Employees WHERE salary > ANY (SELECT salary FROM Management)`. Ce instrucţiune alternativă ar trebui să folosiţi care să dea acelaşi rezultat şi să fie cel puţin la fel de rapidă?
wrong_answers: SELECT name FROM Employees WHERE NOT salary < ALL (SELECT salary FROM Management)
SELECT name FROM Employees WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM Management WHERE salary >= Employees.salary)
SELECT name FROM Employees JOIN Management ON Employees.salary > Management.salary
ro.correct_answer: SELECT name FROM Employees WHERE EXISTS (SELECT * FROM Management WHERE salary < Employees.salary)
ro.explanation: The `EXISTS` clause with a correlated subquery `salary < Employees.salary` is logically equivalent to `> ANY` and is often more efficient for the database engine to process.

en.question: To display names of employees who have a salary greater than that of at least one existing manager, you should use: `SELECT name FROM Employees WHERE salary > ANY (SELECT salary FROM Management)`. Which alternative statement should you use that gives the same result and is at least as fast?
wrong_answers: SELECT name FROM Employees WHERE NOT salary < ALL (SELECT salary FROM Management)
SELECT name FROM Employees WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM Management WHERE salary >= Employees.salary)
SELECT name FROM Employees JOIN Management ON Employees.salary > Management.salary
en.correct_answer: SELECT name FROM Employees WHERE EXISTS (SELECT * FROM Management WHERE salary < Employees.salary)
en.explanation: The `EXISTS` clause with a correlated subquery `salary < Employees.salary` is logically equivalent to `> ANY` and is often more efficient for the database engine to process.

ro.question: Firma la care lucraţi vinde echipamente de la fabricanţi multipli care folosesc ID-uri de produse similare. Trebuie să vă asiguraţi că nu sunt permise intrări multiple pentru acelaţi produs (productID, manufacturerID). Ce instrucţiune ar trebui folosită?
wrong_answers: CREATE TABLE Products ( productID int PRIMARY KEY, manufacturerID int, productName varchar(50), price decimal(7,2))
CREATE TABLE Products ( productID int UNIQUE, manufacturerID int PRIMARY KEY, productName varchar(50), price decimal(7,2))
CREATE TABLE Products ( productID int, manufacturerID int, productName varchar(50) PRIMARY KEY, price decimal(7,2))
ro.correct_answer: CREATE TABLE Products ( productID int, manufacturerID int, productName varchar(50), price decimal(7,2), CONSTRAINT product_key PRIMARY KEY (productID, manufacturerID))
ro.explanation: A composite primary key `PRIMARY KEY (productID, manufacturerID)` ensures that the combination of these two columns is unique for every row in the table.

en.question: The company you work for sells equipment from multiple manufacturers that use similar product IDs. You must ensure that multiple entries for the same product (productID, manufacturerID) are not allowed. Which statement should be used?
wrong_answers: CREATE TABLE Products ( productID int PRIMARY KEY, manufacturerID int, productName varchar(50), price decimal(7,2))
CREATE TABLE Products ( productID int UNIQUE, manufacturerID int PRIMARY KEY, productName varchar(50), price decimal(7,2))
CREATE TABLE Products ( productID int, manufacturerID int, productName varchar(50) PRIMARY KEY, price decimal(7,2))
en.correct_answer: CREATE TABLE Products ( productID int, manufacturerID int, productName varchar(50), price decimal(7,2), CONSTRAINT product_key PRIMARY KEY (productID, manufacturerID))
en.explanation: A composite primary key `PRIMARY KEY (productID, manufacturerID)` ensures that the combination of these two columns is unique for every row in the table.

ro.question:
Aţi creat o vedere folosind comanda: CREATE VIEW dbo.Employee
WITH ENCRYPTION
AS SELECT Name FROM dbo.HumanResources WHERE isEmployee = 1
WITH CHECK OPTION
Trebuie să împiedicaţi alţi utilizatori să copieze vederea. Ce instrucţiune ar trebui să folosiți?
wrong_answers: DENY ALL ON dbo.Employee TO public

ALTER VIEW dbo.Employee
AS SELECT Name FROM dbo.HumanResources WHERE isEmployee = 1
WITH CHECK OPTION

ALTER VIEW dbo.Employee WITH SCHEMABINDING
AS SELECT Name FROM dbo.HumanResources WHERE isEmployee = 1
ro.correct_answer:
ALTER VIEW dbo.Employee WITH ENCRYPTION
AS SELECT Name FROM dbo.HumanResources
WHERE isEmployee = 1
ro.explanation: The `WITH ENCRYPTION` clause obfuscates the text of the view definition in the system metadata, preventing users from viewing or copying the source SQL.

en.question:
You created a view using the command: CREATE VIEW dbo.Employee
WITH ENCRYPTION
AS SELECT Name FROM dbo.HumanResources WHERE isEmployee = 1
WITH CHECK OPTION
You must prevent other users from copying the view. What statement should you use?
wrong_answers: DENY ALL ON dbo.Employee TO public

ALTER VIEW dbo.Employee
AS SELECT Name FROM dbo.HumanResources WHERE isEmployee = 1
WITH CHECK OPTION

ALTER VIEW dbo.Employee WITH SCHEMABINDING
AS SELECT Name FROM dbo.HumanResources WHERE isEmployee = 1
en.correct_answer:
ALTER VIEW dbo.Employee WITH ENCRYPTION
AS SELECT Name FROM dbo.HumanResources
WHERE isEmployee = 1
en.explanation: The `WITH ENCRYPTION` clause obfuscates the text of the view definition in the system metadata, preventing users from viewing or copying the source SQL.

ro.question: Inovarea de proces de afaceri reprezintă:

en.question: Business process innovation represents:
wrong_answers: Exclusively a new business process (invention) for one or more business functions and which was introduced into use (in activity) by the enterprise or capitalized (introduced) on the market.

Exclusively a significantly improved business process for one or more business functions/differs significantly from the enterprise's previous business processes and which was introduced into use (in activity) by the enterprise or capitalized (introduced) on the market.
A new good or service (invention) or one that is significantly improved/differs significantly from the enterprise's previous goods or services and that has been introduced on the market.
en.correct_answer: A new business process (invention) or significantly improved for one or more business functions/differs significantly from the enterprise's previous business processes and which was introduced into use (in activity) by the enterprise or capitalized (introduced) on the market.
en.explanation: Business process innovation includes both completely new processes (inventions) and those significantly improved for business functions, introduced in the enterprise's activity or on the market.

ro.question: Conform Manualului Frascati (2015), cele 5 criterii pe care trebuie să le îndeplinească activităților de cercetare-dezvoltare sunt:
wrong_answers: Fără noutate, necreativ, cu rezultat sigur, nesistematic și netransferabil.

Activitățile de cercetare-dezvoltare nu necesită criterii pentru a fi definite.
ro.correct_answer: Nou, creativ, se adresează unui rezultat incert, sistematic și transferabil sau reproductibil.
ro.explanation: Conform Manualului Frascati (2015), cele 5 criterii sunt: noutatea, creativitatea, incertitudinea rezultatului, caracterul sistematic și transferabilitatea/reproductibilitatea. Toate cele cinci trebuie îndeplinite simultan.

en.question: According to the Frascati Manual (2015), the 5 criteria that research-development activities must meet are:
wrong_answers: No novelty, uncreative, with a certain result, unsystematic and non-transferable.
No novelty, creative, with a certain result, non-transferable and non-reproducible.
Research-development activities do not require criteria to be defined.
en.correct_answer: New, creative, addresses an uncertain result, systematic and transferable or reproducible.
en.explanation: According to the Frascati Manual (2015), the 5 criteria are: novelty, creativity, uncertainty of result, systematic character, and transferability/reproducibility. All five must be met simultaneously.

ro.question:
Ați creat o tabelă folosind instrucțiunea:
CREATE TABLE dbo.Products (ID int IDENTITY(1,1) NOT NULL,
Name nvarchar(60) NOT NULL, Cost decimal(10,2),
SalePrice decimal(10,2), CurrentStock bigint, NumberSold bigint) Un utilizator necesită următoarele tipuri de acces:
SELECT pe coloanele Name și SalePrice;
SELECT pe stocul disponibil(diferența dintre CurrentStock și NumberSold );
ALTER pe coloanele Name și SalePrice.
Trebuie să acordați permisiuni pentru a satisface aceste cerințe, fără a da permisiuni suplimentare sau a restricționa accesul. Ce ar trebui să faceți?
wrong_answers: Acordați utilizatorului permisiunea SELECT pe coloanele Name, SalePrice, CurrentStock și NumberSold și permisiunea ALTER pe coloanele Name și SalePrice din tabela Products.

Acordați utilizatorului permisiunea ALTER pe vederea definită de instrucțiunea: CREATE VIEW dbo.CustomerProductSelect AS SELECT Name, SalePrice, (CurrentStock - NumberSold) AS AvailableStock FROM dbo.Products.
Acordați rolului Public permisiunea SELECT pe coloanele Name, SalePrice, CurrentStock și NumberSold și permisiunea ALTER pe coloanele Name și SalePrice din tabela Products.
ro.correct_answer: Acordați utilizatorului permisiunile SELECT și ALTER pe vederea definită de instrucțiunea: CREATE VIEW dbo.CustomerProduct AS SELECT Name, SalePrice, (CurrentStock - NumberSold) AS AvailableStock FROM dbo.Products.
ro.explanation: No explanation provided.

en.question:
You created a table using the statement:
CREATE TABLE dbo.Products (ID int IDENTITY(1,1) NOT NULL,
Name nvarchar(60) NOT NULL, Cost decimal(10,2),
SalePrice decimal(10,2), CurrentStock bigint, NumberSold bigint) A user requires the following types of access:
SELECT on the Name and SalePrice columns;
SELECT on the available stock (the difference between CurrentStock and NumberSold);
ALTER on the Name and SalePrice columns.
You need to grant permissions to satisfy these requirements without giving additional permissions or restricting access. What should you do?
wrong_answers: Grant the user SELECT permission on the Name, SalePrice, CurrentStock and NumberSold columns and ALTER permission on the Name and SalePrice columns of the Products table.
Grant the user ALTER permission on the view defined by the statement: CREATE VIEW dbo.CustomerProductSelect AS SELECT Name, SalePrice, (CurrentStock - NumberSold) AS AvailableStock FROM dbo.Products.
Grant the Public role SELECT permission on the Name, SalePrice, CurrentStock and NumberSold columns and ALTER permission on the Name and SalePrice columns of the Products table.
en.correct_answer: Grant the user SELECT and ALTER permissions on the view defined by the statement: CREATE VIEW dbo.CustomerProduct AS SELECT Name, SalePrice, (CurrentStock - NumberSold) AS AvailableStock FROM dbo.Products.
en.explanation: No explanation provided.

ro.question: Ce problemă de concurenţă apare când o tranzacţie citeşte datele necomise de o altă tranzacţie aflată în derulare?
ro.explanation: A 'Dirty Read' occurs when a transaction reads data that has been modified by another transaction but not yet committed (and might still be rolled back).

en.explanation: A 'Dirty Read' occurs when a transaction reads data that has been modified by another transaction but not yet committed (and might still be rolled back).

en.question: What does the command cp -r source_dir target_dir do?

en.explanation: The `-r` (recursive) flag tells `cp` to copy the entire directory structure, including all subdirectories and files within it.

ro.question: Ce baze de date RDS sunt disponibile in AWS:

ro.question: Invenția privind linia de asamblare reprezintă un exemplu de:
ro.explanation: Linia de asamblare este o inovare de proces de afaceri deoarece schimbă modul în care se desfășoară producția (procesul), nu produsul în sine. Este o metodă nouă de organizare a producției.

en.question: The invention regarding the assembly line represents an example of:

ro.question: Inovarea de produs reprezintă:
wrong_answers: Exclusiv un bun sau un serviciu nou (invenție) care a fost introdus pe piață.
Exclusiv un bun sau un serviciu care este semnificativ îmbunătățit față de bunurile sau serviciile anterioare ale întreprinderii și care a fost introdus pe piață.

Un proces de afaceri nou (invenție) sau care este semnificativ îmbunătățit față de procesele de afaceri anterioare ale întreprinderii (firmei) și care a fost introdus pe piață sau în activitatea întreprinderii.
ro.correct_answer: Un bun sau un serviciu nou (invenție) sau care este semnificativ îmbunătățit față de bunurile sau serviciile anterioare ale întreprinderii și care a fost introdus pe piață.
ro.explanation: Inovarea de produs include atât bunuri/servicii complet noi (invenții), cât și cele semnificativ îmbunătățite față de cele anterioare, introduse pe piață. Nu se limitează exclusiv la una dintre cele două surse.

en.question: Product innovation represents:
wrong_answers: Exclusively a new good or service (invention) that has been introduced on the market.
Exclusively a good or service that is significantly improved compared to the previous goods or services of the enterprise and that has been introduced on the market.

A new business process (invention) or one that is significantly improved compared to the previous business processes of the enterprise (firm) and that has been introduced on the market or in the enterprise's activity.
en.correct_answer: A new good or service (invention) or one that is significantly improved compared to the previous goods or services of the enterprise and that has been introduced on the market.
en.explanation: Product innovation includes both completely new goods/services (inventions) and those significantly improved compared to previous ones, introduced on the market. It is not limited exclusively to one of the two sources.

ro.question:
Ce se va obţine prin următoarea interogare (Transact) SQL:
```sql
SELECT Nume FROM STUDENTI INNER JOIN LOCALIT ON STUDENTI.CodLoc=LOCALIT.CodLoc
WHERE CodLoc NOT IN (SELECT CodLoc FROM STUDENTI WHERE Nume = ‘Ionescu M Petre’)
```
wrong_answers: Numele studenţilor asemănătoare cu 'Ionescu M Petre'
Codul localităţii din care este studentul 'Ionescu M Petre'
Numărul studenţilor care nu sunt din aceeaşi localitate cu 'Ionescu M Petre'
ro.correct_answer: Numele studenţilor care nu sunt din aceeaşi localitate cu 'Ionescu M Petre'
ro.explanation: The subquery identifies the locality of 'Ionescu M Petre'. The `NOT IN` clause then filters for students whose locality is different from that one.

en.question:
What will be obtained by the following (Transact) SQL query:
```sql
SELECT Nume FROM STUDENTI INNER JOIN LOCALIT ON STUDENTI.CodLoc=LOCALIT.CodLoc
WHERE CodLoc NOT IN (SELECT CodLoc FROM STUDENTI WHERE Nume = ‘Ionescu M Petre’)
```
wrong_answers: Names of students similar to 'Ionescu M Petre'
Locality code from which student 'Ionescu M Petre' originates
Number of students who are not from the same locality as 'Ionescu M Petre'
en.correct_answer: Names of students who are not from the same locality as 'Ionescu M Petre'
en.explanation: The subquery identifies the locality of 'Ionescu M Petre'. The `NOT IN` clause then filters for students whose locality is different from that one.

en.correct_answer: The most complex correlation between cryptogram and key;

```python
print(L)
```

Considerând că 7 regizori au trimis intervalele de desfăşurare ale spectacolelor lor s₁ = [08: 00, 10: 30], s₂ = [08: 30, 11: 00], s₃ = [16: 30, 18: 00], s₄ = [10: 30, 10: 45], s₅ = [11: 00, 12: 00], s₆ = [12: 30, 16: 00], s₇ = [17: 15, 18: 45], precizați care dintre variantele de mai jos reprezintă o planificare corectă, cu un număr maxim de spectacole:
ro.explanation: Aplicarea strategiei Greedy bazată pe timpul de terminare rezultă în setul {S1, S4, S5, S6, S7}.

Each director sent the festival organizer the time interval [hh₁: mm₁, hh₂: mm₂] in which their performance can take place. Knowing that performances cannot overlap and there is no break between any two consecutive performances, the festival organizer thought of using a Greedy planning strategy to schedule a maximum number of performances. Considering that 7 directors sent the intervals s₁ = [08: 00, 10: 30], s₂ = [08: 30, 11: 00], s₃ = [16: 30, 18: 00], s₄ = [10: 30, 10: 45], s₅ = [11: 00, 12: 00], s₆ = [12: 30, 16: 00], s₇ = [17: 15, 18: 45], specify which of the variants below represents a correct planning with a maximum number of performances:
en.explanation: Applying the finish-time Greedy strategy to the given intervals results in the set {S1, S4, S5, S6, S7}.

en.correct_answer: Parametric string of static or dynamic values that particularizes the behavior of the cryptographic function.

ro.question: In raport cu sursa de acoperire a cheltuielilor cardurile se impart in:

carduri de credit - care asigura utilizatorului achizitionarea de bunuri si servicii sau retrageri de numerar, pe baza unei linii de credit acordate posesorului de card

carduri de debit - care asigura utilizatorului achizitionarea de bunuri si servicii sau retrageri de numerar, cu conditia prezervarii unor fonduri intr-un cont de card, si efectuarea de cheltuieli in limita soldului disponibil

en.question: In relation to the source of covering expenses, cards are divided into:

debit cards - which ensure the user purchase of goods and services or cash withdrawals, provided funds are preserved in a card account, and making expenses within the limit of the available balance
en.explanation: In relation to the source of expense coverage, cards are divided into credit cards and debit cards. Magnetic stripe cards are classified by security storage method, not by the source of expense coverage.

ro.question: Care dintre următoarele secvențe de instrucțiuni Python nu afișează valoarea 4210?
wrong_answers:
```python
s = 0
for i in range(4210): s += 1
print(s)
```

```python
s = 9
for i in range(4): s = s // 2
print(s, end="")
```

```python
L = [str(x*2) if x < 3 else '1' for x in range(4)]
L.sort(reverse=True)
print("".join(L))
```
ro.explanation: Bucla se termină când s este 4211, deci afișează 4211 în loc de 4210.

en.question: Which of the following sequences of Python instructions does not display the value 4210?
wrong_answers:
```python
s = 0
for i in range(4210): s += 1
print(s)
```

```python
s = 9
for i in range(4): s = s // 2
print(s, end="")
```

```python
L = [str(x*2) if x < 3 else '1' for x in range(4)]
L.sort(reverse=True)
print("".join(L))
```
en.explanation: The loop ends when s is 4211, so it prints 4211 instead of 4210.

ro.question:
Considerăm următorul program Python:
```python
def f(L):
L[0], L[1] = L[1], L[0]
L = L[2:] + L[0:2]

L = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
f(L)
print(L)
```
Ce se va afișa pe ecran după executarea programului de mai sus?
ro.explanation: Modificările in-place ale unei liste se reflectă la apelant, dar reatribuirea variabilei nu.

en.question:
Consider the following Python program:
```python
def f(L):
L[0], L[1] = L[1], L[0]
L = L[2:] + L[0:2]

L = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
f(L)
print(L)
```
What will be displayed on the screen after executing the program above?
en.explanation: In-place modifications to a list reflect in the caller, but reassigning the variable does not.

wrong_answers: constructor 1 constructor 2 constructor 1 destructor 1 destructor 2 destructor 1
ro.correct_answer: constructor 1 constructor 1 constructor 2 destructor 2 destructor 1 destructor 1
ro.explanation: ob1 apelează constructorul c1. ob2 apelează întâi constructorul clasei de bază c1 și apoi pe cel al clasei c2. La finalul programului, obiectele sunt distruse în ordine inversă: ob2 apelează ~c2 apoi ~c1, iar ob1 apelează ~c1.

wrong_answers: constructor 1 constructor 2 constructor 1 destructor 1 destructor 2 destructor 1
en.correct_answer: constructor 1 constructor 1 constructor 2 destructor 2 destructor 1 destructor 1
en.explanation: ob1 calls the c1 constructor. ob2 calls the base class constructor c1 first, then the c2 constructor. At the end of the program, objects are destroyed in reverse order: ob2 calls ~c2 then ~c1, and ob1 calls ~c1.

ro.explanation: În M1, moștenirea multiplă standard de la D1 și D2 (care au baze B nevirtuale) duce la existența a două copii de B. Pentru M2, utilizarea cuvântului cheie virtual în ierarhie (de obicei presupunând moștenirea virtuală de la B) asigură existența unei singure instanțe a bazei comune B.

en.explanation: In M1, standard multiple inheritance from D1 and D2 (which have non-virtual B bases) leads to two copies of B. For M2, using the virtual keyword in the hierarchy (usually assuming virtual inheritance from B) ensures the existence of a single instance of the common base B.

ro.question: Polimorfismul dinamic în limbajul C++ se realizează cu ajutorul:

ro.question: Care dintre următoarele afirmații este adevărată pentru o metodă Java de tip final?

nu poate fi nici suprascrisă și nici supraîncărcată

it can be overridden but not overloaded

ro.explanation: Suprascrierea metodelor asigură că implementarea din tipul real al obiectului (Calcul_3) este mereu apelată.

en.explanation: Method overriding ensures that the implementation in the actual object type (Calcul_3) is always called.

ro.explanation: Metodele statice nu sunt polimorfice; metoda apelată depinde de tipul referinței (Super sau Sub).

ro.question: Datorită mutării activităţii comerciale din Germania în SUA, trebuie să schimbăm collation data pentru baza de date Adventure Works. După modificarea collation pentru această bază de date, ce ar mai trebui să faceţi?

ro.explanation: Changing the database collation doesn't automatically update existing table columns. You must manually change the collation for each column and recreate any dependent objects like indexes and constraints.

en.correct_answer: Delete indices and constraints of existing tables for which collation requires change. Change collation for columns of those tables. Recreate indices and constraints.
en.explanation: Changing the database collation doesn't automatically update existing table columns. You must manually change the collation for each column and recreate any dependent objects like indexes and constraints.

ro.question: Puteţi folosi o procedură stocată pentru a extrage informaţii din tabele de bază la care nu aveţi permisiuni de acces?

Da, dacă aţi creat declanşatori pentru fiecare tabel
ro.correct_answer: Da, dacă aveţi permisiunea EXECUTE pentru procedura stocată
ro.explanation: This is known as an ownership chain. If the owner of the procedure and the table is the same, a user only needs `EXECUTE` permission on the procedure to access the underlying data.

ro.question:
Se dă tabelul
STUDENT(CNP, Nume, Grupa, Adresa)
şi următoarea secvenţă ce reprezintă o tranzacţie:
CREATE table STUDENT_NOU ( CNP NUMBER, Nume VARCHAR(30)) INSERT INTO STUDENT_NOU SELECT CNP, Nume from STUDENT
Savepoint s1
UPDATE STUDENT_NOU SET Nume = UPPER(Nume)
Savepoint s2
DELETE FROM STUDENT_NOU
Rollback to s2
DELETE FROM STUDENT_NOU WHERE CNP=100 UPDATE STUDENT_NOU SET Nume = 'Ionescu'
Rollback to s2


UPDATE STUDENT_NOU SET Nume = 'Ionescu' WHERE CNP=100
Rollback
Care este rezultatul acestei tranzacţii pentru tabela STUDENT_NOU?
wrong_answers: Nu putem să facem Rollback mai mult de o dată pe un punct de reluare
Ultimul UPDATE eşuează deoarece studentul cu CNP-ul 100 a fost şters
ro.explanation: The final `Rollback` (without a savepoint) undoes all changes made since the beginning of the transaction or the last commit. Since the `CREATE TABLE` and `INSERT` were part of the transaction, they are also rolled back, leaving the table empty or non-existent (depending on the DBMS behavior for DDL in transactions).

en.question:
Given the table
STUDENT(CNP, Nume, Grupa, Adresa)
and the following sequence representing a transaction:
CREATE table STUDENT_NOU ( CNP NUMBER, Nume VARCHAR(30)) INSERT INTO STUDENT_NOU SELECT CNP, Nume from STUDENT
Savepoint s1
UPDATE STUDENT_NOU SET Nume = UPPER(Nume)
Savepoint s2
DELETE FROM STUDENT_NOU
Rollback to s2
DELETE FROM STUDENT_NOU WHERE CNP=100 UPDATE STUDENT_NOU SET Nume = 'Ionescu'
Rollback to s2


UPDATE STUDENT_NOU SET Nume = 'Ionescu' WHERE CNP=100
Rollback
What is the result of this transaction for the STUDENT_NOU table?
wrong_answers: We cannot Rollback more than once to a savepoint
The last UPDATE fails because the student with CNP 100 was deleted
en.correct_answer: We have no rows in the table
en.explanation: The final `Rollback` (without a savepoint) undoes all changes made since the beginning of the transaction or the last commit. Since the `CREATE TABLE` and `INSERT` were part of the transaction, they are also rolled back, leaving the table empty or non-existent (depending on the DBMS behavior for DDL in transactions).

ro.explanation: Primul delete b apelează ~B(). Al doilea new D() apelează B() apoi D(). Al doilea delete b apelează DOAR ~B() deoarece destructorul clasei de bază nu este declarat virtual, deci nu se realizează legarea dinamică pentru distrugere.

en.explanation: The first delete b calls ~B(). The second new D() calls B() then D(). The second delete b calls ONLY ~B() because the base class destructor is not declared virtual, so dynamic binding for destruction is not performed.

wrong_answers: A1 A2 AA2 A1 AA1 B
A2 A2 AA2 AA1 A1 B
A1 A2 AA2 A1 B AA1
ro.correct_answer: A2 A1 AA2 A1 AA1 B
ro.explanation: Ordinea constructorilor: întâi bazele virtuale (A2, apoi A1 și AA2 din ierarhia lui AA2 care e bază virtuală a lui B), apoi bazele nevirtuale (A1 și AA1), și la final clasa derivată B. Bazele virtuale sunt construite o singură dată.

wrong_answers: A1 A2 AA2 A1 AA1 B
A2 A2 AA2 AA1 A1 B
A1 A2 AA2 A1 B AA1
en.correct_answer: A2 A1 AA2 A1 AA1 B
en.explanation: Constructor order: first the virtual bases (A2, then A1 and AA2 from the hierarchy of AA2 which is a virtual base of B), then non-virtual bases (A1 and AA1), and finally the derived class B. Virtual bases are constructed only once.

ro.question:

Ce instrucţiune SELECT trebuie să folosiţi?
wrong_answers: SELECT depID, (firstName + ' ' + lastName) AS 'Full Name' FROM Employees ORDER BY depID, lastName ASC
SELECT lastName, (firstName + ' ' + lastName) AS 'Full Name' FROM Employees ORDER BY lastName, depID

ro.correct_answer: SELECT (firstName + ' ' + lastName) AS 'Full Name' FROM Employees ORDER BY depID DESC, 'Full Name'
ro.explanation: The query concatenates `firstName` and `lastName` into 'Full Name' and uses `ORDER BY depID DESC, 'Full Name'` to achieve the specified sorting.

en.question:

en.correct_answer: SELECT (firstName + ' ' + lastName) AS 'Full Name' FROM Employees ORDER BY depID DESC, 'Full Name'
en.explanation: The query concatenates `firstName` and `lastName` into 'Full Name' and uses `ORDER BY depID DESC, 'Full Name'` to achieve the specified sorting.

ro.question: La un ghişeu stau la coadă 7 persoane p₁, p₂, … , p₇. wrong_answers: p₇, p₂, p₆, p₅, p₁, p₃, p₄
p₇, p₂, p₆, p₅, p₁, p₄, p₃
p₇, p₂, p₆, p₁, p₅, p₄, p₃
ro.correct_answer: p₇, p₆, p₂, p₅, p₁, p₄, p₃
ro.explanation: Ordinea optimă trebuie să urmeze timpii de servire crescători; orice ordine care încalcă acest lucru este sub-optimă.

en.question: At a counter, 7 people p₁, p₂, … , p₇ are in line. Knowing their service times t₁ = 12, t₂ = 6, t₃ = 15, t₄ = 15, t₅ = 12, t₆ = 8, t₇ = 2 and knowing that to serve a person, all people before them must be served first, specify which of the following rearrangements of people in line does not minimize the average waiting time:
wrong_answers: p₇, p₂, p₆, p₅, p₁, p₃, p₄
p₇, p₂, p₆, p₅, p₁, p₄, p₃
p₇, p₂, p₆, p₁, p₅, p₄, p₃
en.correct_answer: p₇, p₆, p₂, p₅, p₁, p₄, p₃
en.explanation: The optimal order must follow ascending service times; any order that violates this (like p6 before p2) is sub-optimal.

ro.question: În Aula Magna a Universității Titu Maiorescu din București se va organiza un festival de teatru care va dura o singură zi. Fiecare regizor a transmis organizatorului festivalului intervalul de timp [hh₁: mm₁, hh₂: mm₂] în care se poate desfășura spectacolul său. Știind că spectacolele nu se pot suprapune și între oricare două spectacole consecutive nu există nicio pauză, organizatorul festivalului s-a gândit să folosească o strategie de planificare de tip Greedy pentru a planifica un număr maxim de spectacole în cadrul festivalului. Considerând că 7 regizori au trimis intervalele de desfăşurare ale spectacolelor lor s₁ = [08: 00, 10: 30], s₂ = [08: 30, 09: 00], s₃ = [16: 30, 18: 00], s₄ = [10: 30, 10: 45], s₅ = [11: 00, 17: 00], s₆ = [11: 30, 13: 00], s₇ = [15: 15, 16: 45], precizați care dintre variantele de mai jos reprezintă o planificare corectă, cu un număr maxim de spectacole:
ro.explanation: Aplicarea strategiei Greedy bazată pe timpul de terminare rezultă în setul {S2, S4, S6, S7}.

en.question: In the Aula Magna of Titu Maiorescu University in Bucharest, a theater festival will be organized that will last one single day. Each director sent the festival organizer the time interval [hh₁: mm₁, hh₂: mm₂] in which their performance can take place. Knowing that performances cannot overlap and there is no break between any two consecutive performances, the festival organizer thought of using a Greedy planning strategy to schedule a maximum number of performances. Considering that 7 directors sent the intervals s₁ = [08: 00, 10: 30], s₂ = [08: 30, 09: 00], s₃ = [16: 30, 18: 00], s₄ = [10: 30, 10: 45], s₅ = [11: 00, 17: 00], s₆ = [11: 30, 13: 00], s₇ = [15: 15, 16: 45], specify which of the variants below represents a correct planning with a maximum number of performances:
en.explanation: Applying the finish-time Greedy strategy to the given intervals results in the set {S2, S4, S6, S7}.

ro.question:
Ce se va obţine prin următoarea interogare (Transact) SQL:
```sql
SELECT Nume FROM STUDENTI INNER JOIN LOCALIT ON STUDENTI.CodLoc=LOCALIT.CodLoc
WHERE CodLoc IN 
(SELECT CodLoc FROM STUDENTI WHERE Nume = ‘Ionescu M Petre’)
```
wrong_answers: Numele studenţilor asemănătoare cu Ionescu M Petre
Codul localităţii din care este studentul Ionescu M Petre
Numărul studenţilor care sunt din aceeaşi localitate cu Ionescu M Petre
ro.correct_answer: Numele studenţilor care sunt din aceeaşi localitate cu Ionescu M Petre
ro.explanation: The subquery finds the `CodLoc` for 'Ionescu M Petre'. The outer query then selects the names of all students who have that same `CodLoc`.

en.question:
What will be obtained by the following (Transact) SQL query:
```sql
SELECT Nume FROM STUDENTI INNER JOIN LOCALIT ON STUDENTI.CodLoc=LOCALIT.CodLoc
WHERE CodLoc IN 
(SELECT CodLoc FROM STUDENTI WHERE Nume = ‘Ionescu M Petre’)
```
wrong_answers: Student names similar to Ionescu M Petre
Locality code from which student Ionescu M Petre originates
Number of students from the same locality as Ionescu M Petre
en.correct_answer: Names of students from the same locality as Ionescu M Petre
en.explanation: The subquery finds the `CodLoc` for 'Ionescu M Petre'. The outer query then selects the names of all students who have that same `CodLoc`.

ro.question: O bază de date distribuită este:
wrong_answers: O colecţie de date împărţită în mai multe fragmente
O colecţie de date împărţită în mai multe replici
ro.correct_answer: O colecţie de date şi de scheme partajate şi interconectate logic, distribuite fizic pe calculatoarele unei reţele
ro.explanation: A distributed database consists of multiple interconnected database parts located at different physical sites, but appearing as a single logical database to the user.

en.question: A distributed database is:
wrong_answers: A collection of data split into multiple fragments
A collection of data split into multiple replicas
en.correct_answer: A collection of logically shared and interconnected data and schemas, physically distributed over the computers of a network
en.explanation: A distributed database consists of multiple interconnected database parts located at different physical sites, but appearing as a single logical database to the user.

ro.question: Care dintre următoarele afirmaţii sunt adevărate despre constrângeri?
wrong_answers: Constrângerile la nivel de coloană se aplică pe anumite coloane sau combinaţii de coloane
Indecşii creaţi de constrângerile PRIMARY KEY şi UNIQUE KEY pot fi şterşi folosind instrucţiunea DROP INDEX
Constrângerile nu pot fi adăugate sau şterse dintr-o tabelă fără a afecta structura tabelei
ro.correct_answer: Dacă nu se specifică un nume pentru constrângere, server-ul de baze de date oferă unul
ro.explanation: If you don't provide a name when creating a constraint (like `PRIMARY KEY` or `CHECK`), the database system generates a unique internal name for it.

en.question: Which of the following statements are true about constraints?
wrong_answers: Column-level constraints apply to specific columns or combinations of columns
Indexes created by PRIMARY KEY and UNIQUE KEY constraints can be deleted using the DROP INDEX statement
Constraints cannot be added or deleted from a table without affecting the table structure
en.correct_answer: If a constraint name is not specified, the database server provides one
en.explanation: If you don't provide a name when creating a constraint (like `PRIMARY KEY` or `CHECK`), the database system generates a unique internal name for it.

ro.question: Care grup de instrucţiuni se poate utiliza prin acordarea permisiunilor obiect?
ro.explanation: Object permissions control access to data within objects and include `SELECT`, `INSERT`, `UPDATE`, and `DELETE`.

en.question: Which group of statements can be used by granting object permissions?
en.explanation: Object permissions control access to data within objects and include `SELECT`, `INSERT`, `UPDATE`, and `DELETE`.

ro.question: Cum execuți un script Bash în fundal?
ro.explanation: Appending `&` to a command runs it in the background. `nohup` (no hang up) allows the command to continue running even after the user logs out.

en.question: How do you execute a Bash script in the background?
en.explanation: Appending `&` to a command runs it in the background. `nohup` (no hang up) allows the command to continue running even after the user logs out.

ro.question: Ce face comanda read -p "Introdu numele: " nume?
wrong_answers: Scrie "Introdu numele: " într-un fișier numit nume.
Caută numele în variabilele de mediu.
ro.correct_answer: Afișează "Introdu numele: " și salvează răspunsul în variabila nume.
ro.explanation: The `read` command pauses execution to get user input. The `-p` flag provides a prompt string, and the input is stored in the variable `nume`.

en.question: What does the command read -p "Enter name: " name do?
wrong_answers: Writes "Enter name: " to a file named name.
Displays the content of the file name.
Searches for the name in environment variables.
en.correct_answer: Displays "Enter name: " and saves the response in the variable name.
en.explanation: The `read` command pauses execution to get user input. The `-p` flag provides a prompt string, and the input is stored in the variable `nume`.

ro.question: Care este metrica folosită de RIP pentru determinarea căii optime?
wrong_answers: Lățimea de bandă maximă pană la destinație
Rata de eroare minimă până la destinație
ro.correct_answer: Numărul minim de salturi pană la destinație
ro.explanation: RIP uses a simple 'hop count' metric, where each router the packet passes through counts as one hop.

en.question: What is the metric used by RIP to determine the optimal path?
wrong_answers: Minimum error rate to the destination
en.correct_answer: Minimum number of hops to the destination
en.explanation: RIP uses a simple 'hop count' metric, where each router the packet passes through counts as one hop.

ro.question: Care este rolul unui ruter într o rețea?
wrong_answers: Să facă rezoluția adresă IP adresă MAC
Să descopere toate echipamentele destinație din rețea
ro.correct_answer: Să găzduiască tabelele de rutare și să forwardeze spre destinație pachetele IP sosite
ro.explanation: The primary function of a router is to examine incoming packets, look up the destination in its routing table, and forward the packet toward its final destination.

en.question: What is the role of a router in a network?
wrong_answers: To perform IP address to MAC address resolution
To discover all destination equipment in the network
en.correct_answer: To host routing tables and forward incoming IP packets to the destination
en.explanation: The primary function of a router is to examine incoming packets, look up the destination in its routing table, and forward the packet toward its final destination.

ro.question: Care dintre următoarele este o adresă multicast în IPv4?
ro.explanation: IPv4 multicast addresses are in the Class D range, which spans from 224.0.0.0 to 239.255.255.255.

en.question: Which of the following is a multicast address in IPv4?
en.explanation: IPv4 multicast addresses are in the Class D range, which spans from 224.0.0.0 to 239.255.255.255.

ro.question: Care dintre afirmațiile de mai jos nu reprezintă un criteriu de aleatorism propus de Golomb:
wrong_answers: Dacă p este par atunci secvența de lungime p va avea p/2 biți de valoare 0 şi p/2 biți de valoarea 1. Dacă p este impar, atunci numărul de zerouri si numărul de cifre unu diferă printr o unitate;
Într o secvență de lungime p, jumătate din numărul seriilor va avea lungimea 1, 1/4 va avea lungimea 2,...,1/ 2k din numărul seriilor va avea lungimea k;
ro.explanation: Golomb's third postulate states that the dephased autocorrelation function must be constant for a sequence to be considered pseudo-random.

en.question: Which of the statements below does not represent a randomness criterion proposed by Golomb:
wrong_answers: If p is even then the sequence of length p will have p/2 bits of value 0 and p/2 bits of value 1. If p is odd, then the number of zeros and number of ones differ by one;
In a sequence of length p, half the number of series will have length 1, 1/4 will have length 2, ..., 1/2k of the number of series will have length k;
en.explanation: Golomb's third postulate states that the dephased autocorrelation function must be constant for a sequence to be considered pseudo-random.

ro.question: Definiția dată de Shannon pentru un sistem de cifrare este:
wrong_answers: Un sistem de cifrare realizează o compresie a sursei de date:
Un sistem de cifrare folosește chei de cifrare pentru compresia sursei de date;
Un sistem de cifrare folosește algoritmul Shannon Fano pentru realizarea operațiunii de cifrare.
ro.correct_answer: Un sistem de cifrare este o familie T de transformări inversabile dintr o mulțime de mesaje M într o mulțime de criptograme C;
ro.explanation: Shannon mathematically defined a cipher as a set of transformations that map a set of possible messages to a set of possible cryptograms in an invertible way.

en.question: Shannon's definition for an encryption system is:
wrong_answers: An encryption system performs a data source compression:
An encryption system uses encryption keys for data source compression;
An encryption system uses the Shannon-Fano algorithm to perform the encryption operation.
en.correct_answer: An encryption system is a family T of invertible transformations from a set of messages M into a set of cryptograms C;
en.explanation: Shannon mathematically defined a cipher as a set of transformations that map a set of possible messages to a set of possible cryptograms in an invertible way.

ro.question: Ce este Socket.IO în contextul Node.js?

Un modul folosit pentru gestionarea dependențelor în Node.js.
Un parser JSON pentru comunicare între aplicații.
ro.correct_answer: O bibliotecă utilizată pentru comunicare în timp real între client și server.
ro.explanation: No explanation provided.

en.question: What is Socket.IO in the context of Node.js?
wrong_answers: A framework for creating RESTful web applications.
A module used for managing dependencies in Node.js.
A JSON parser for communication between applications.
en.correct_answer: A library used for real-time communication between client and server.
en.explanation: No explanation provided.

wrong_answers: Instalează Express, dar nu îl salvează în package.json.

Rulează aplicația Express local pe portul 8080.
ro.correct_answer: Instalează Express ca dependență și îl salvează automat în package.json.

Creates an HTTP server in Node.js.
Runs the Express application locally on port 8080.
en.correct_answer: Installs Express as a dependency and automatically saves it in package.json.
